intro: Aegopodium komarovii, commonly known as Komarov's ground-ivy, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
